benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to bundle

covered: Valid Request: Successful modifications with valid payloads (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC22, TC23, TC25).
Invalid Input Handling: 400 responses for invalid bundleId, missing header, malformed body, missing body, and unsupported fields (TC04, TC06, TC07, TC08, TC09).
System/Dependency Failures: 503 for system unavailable (TC11) and 500 for dependent data inconsistencies (TC20).
Input Sanitization: protection against SQL injection (TC12).
Edge Cases: maximum number of fields (TC13), maximum field value length (TC14), empty value (TC15), extra URL parameter (TC16).
State Variations: no existing fields (TC22), update existing fields (TC23), partial updates (TC24), backward compatibility (TC25).
Performance: normal load and peak load (TC17, TC18).
Integration: inconsistent data from dependent service (TC20).
gaps: Concurrency/Race condition testing for simultaneous updates on the same bundle is not explicitly covered.
403 Forbidden scenarios for insufficient permissions not tested.
Caching behavior (ETag/Cache-Control) not tested for PUT responses.
Validation of invalid inner field data types (beyond string content) not explicitly tested.
Tests for payloads exceeding edge limits beyond TC13.
recommendations: Add explicit concurrency/race-condition tests to verify correct behavior under simultaneous updates to the same bundle.
Add 403 authorization tests (insufficient permissions) and token expiry scenarios.
Introduce rate-limiting tests to ensure proper handling under high request volume.
Validate caching headers on PUT responses where applicable (ETag/Cache-Control).
Expand payload validation to cover invalid inner field data types and structures (e.g., numeric types where strings expected).
Add tests for payloads exceeding edge limits to ensure proper error handling.
